infotexts.stasisbugequipconfirmation: Are you sure you want put stasis bag on yourself?
infotexts.entitydescription.am_aed: A medical device delivering an electric shock to the heart to stabilize cardiac arythmias. Use on a patient with ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation.
infotexts.entityname.am_scalpel:
Scalpel A tool used to make incisions during surgery.
Hemostat A tool used to clamp blood vessels during surgery.
Retractors A tool used to retract skin during surgery.
AutoPulse An automated, portable, battery-powered cardiopulmonary resuscitation device.
Blood analysis cartridge Empty cartridge, insert it inside Blood analyser.
Ambu bag A bag valve mask (am_bvm), is a hand-held device commonly used to provide positive pressure ventilation to patients who are not breathing or not breathing adequately.
Stasis bag Stops biological processes and protects against cerebral hypoxia.
Surgical saw A tool used to saw through bones.
Suture Biodegradeable sutures for stitching up lacerations and surgical incisions alike.
Surgical drill A tool used to drill bones.
Mannitol Plus A highly complicated and expensive medicinal compound which stimulates the regeneration of neurological tissue.
Osteosynthesis Implants Titanium implants used in an open reduction surgery to repair fractures.
Operating table An operation table which has basic artificial ventilation built in.
Antibiotic ointment A highly antiseptic gel that promotes the recovery from burns as well as from minor infections.
Tweezers A small tool that allows the removal of bullets as well as damaged and necrotic tissue.
Tourniquet A device that applies pressure to a limb and thus reduces bloodflow. It is usually used in case of major bleeders on extremities.
Test tube rack Rack for storing test tubes and vials.
Blood analyzer Blood analysis device that outputs a donor card with patient's blood type via sample collection. Insert a cartridge to use.
Ventricular Tachycardia Very high pulse due to low oxygen or blood pressure detected.
Ventricular Fibrillation Irregular electrical activity in the cardiac muscle detected.
Asystole No electrical activity in the cardiac muscle detected.
Hypotension Pulse strength has become weaker.
Cerebral Hypoxia Patient is showing signs of nerve and brain damage. Brain dead You have died of Cerebral Hypoxia.
Surgery incision An incision made by a scalpel.
Clamped bleeding Surgical bleeders have been staunched.
Clamped arteries Bleeding from artery has been stopped temporarily.
Splint Fracture has been splinted.
Drilled bones The bones have been prepared for orthopedic procedures.
Retracted skin The skin is being held open by a set of retractors.
Stitched incision An incision has been closed via sutures.
Stitched wound Wounds have been sutured shut.
Bones Sawed The bones are sliced open.
Fracture One or more bones are broken and cause severe pain and locomotive issues.
Arterial bleeding An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.
Traumatic shock The patient experiences severe pain and stress.
Anesthesia Insensitivity to pain.
Necrosis
Died from a necrotic wound. You have died from necrosis.
Sepsis Your body's response to trauma is causing sepsis and its complications are going to lead to death from septic shock. Died from sepsis. You have died from sepsis.
Infected wound The injury is looking red and swollen.
Bandaged Protective layers of bandaging material prevent the wound from getting infected.
Ointment A layer of antibiotic gel protects and cleans the wound from any germs.
